org.aludratest.scheduler.impl

Class ExecutionPlan

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.aludratest.scheduler.impl.ExecutionPlan

  • public class ExecutionPlan
extends Object
    Class to calculate an execution plan based on a RunnerTree and its internal execution dependencies (sequential nodes, or @SequentialGroup annotations). It collects all test cases contained in the tree and calculates the execution dependencies for each. Afterwards, the test cases are ordered by the number of dependent test cases, putting the test cases with most dependent test cases first. This gives the best chance that test cases are executed as early as possible, thus reducing the "Sequential Overhead", the effect that in the end, only one Thread is busy working through a long list of sequential test cases.
    Author:
    falbrech

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExecutionPlan

        public ExecutionPlan()

    • Method Detail

      • buildExecutionPlan

        public void buildExecutionPlan(RunnerTree tree)
        Populates this execution plan with the test cases contained in the given RunnerTree structure.
        Parameters:
        tree - RunnerTree, as created by a RunnerTreeBuilder component.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Determines whether there are any more items available in this execution plan, i.e. if a call to getNextExecutableLeaf() will at some point in the future return a non-null value.
        Returns:
        true if you cannot expect this execution plan to provide any more RunnerLeafs, false otherwise.

      • getNextExecutableLeaf

        public RunnerLeaf getNextExecutableLeaf()
        Returns the next RunnerLeaf in this execution plan which is ready for execution, i.e. all of its prerequisites are fulfilled. This may return null if there is currently no such RunnerLeaf, but this could change as soon as a RunnerLeaf is finished which is a prerequisite for another leaf.
        If isEmpty() returns true, this will always return null.
        Returns:
        The next RunnerLeaf in this execution plan which is ready for execution, or null if there currently is no such element.

      • removeFinishedRunnerLeaf

        public void removeFinishedRunnerLeaf(RunnerLeaf leaf)
        Removes the entry for a finished RunnerLeaf from this execution plan. This should typically be called as soon as a RunnerLeaf's execution is complete.
        Parameters:
        leaf - Leaf for which to remove the entry from this execution plan.
